[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9]
Listing 5.2: Example of a univariate time series.
We could average the last one observation (9), the last two observations (8, 9), and so on.
In the case of seasonal data, we may want to average the last n-prior observations at the same
time in the cycle as the time that is being forecasted. For example, given the series with a
3-step cycle:
